SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The patient died while in a medical center such as a hospital, skilled nursing facility (SNF), intermediate care facility (ICF), or a freestanding hospice center.
The absence of life or state of being dead. (NCI)
The patient will be admitted to a medical center that is funded by the federal government (e.g. Veterans Affairs Hospital).
The patient will return home but personal health maintenance will be administered and monitored by a member of a healthcare organization that is eligible to receive Medicare funding.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: HOME UNDER CARE OF ORGANIZED HOME HEALTH SERVICE ORGANIZATION IN ANTICIPATION OF COVERED SKILLED CARE
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Home Under Care of Organized Home Health Service Organization in Anticipation of Covered Skilled Care

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The patient will receive end-of-life care which will be administered in the patient's home.
The patient will receive professional nursing care provided within the home of the patient.
A routine discharge where personal health maintenance will be administered and monitored by the patient from their home.
The patient will receive end-of-life care which will be administered in a medical center.
The patient will be admitted into a medical center and receive a type of hospital bed that will be paid for my Medicare.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Hospital with Medicare Approved Swing Bed

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The patient will be admitted full time into a free standing rehabilitation center or a rehabilitation center within a general medical facility.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: INPATIENT REHABILITATION FACILITY (IRF) INCLUDING REHABILITATION DISTINCT PART UNITS OF A HOSPITAL
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility Including Rehabilitation distinct Part Units of a Hospital

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The patient will be admitted into an alternative facility not listed.
The patient will be admitted into a medical center that provides care 24 hours per day.
The patient vacated the medical center or ceased medical care contrary to the recommendation of a trained healthcare provider.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: LEFT AGAINST MEDICAL ADVICE OR DISCONTINUED CARE

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The patient will be admitted into a hospital equipped and staffed to provide prolonged care to patients.
The patient will be admitted to a long-term nursing care facility.
The patient will be admitted into a Medicare funded medical center for a considerable length of time.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Medicare Certified Long Term Care Hospital

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The patient will be admitted into a medical center which is eligible to receive funding from Medicaid but not Medicare.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: NURSING FACILITY CERTIFIED UNDER MEDICAID BUT NOT CERTIFIED UNDER MEDICARE
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Nursing Facility Certified Under Medicaid but Not Certified Under Medicare

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The patient will be admitted into a free standing medical facility or a unit within a general medical facility used for the treatment of mental health disorders.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: PSYCHIATRIC HOSPITAL OR A PSYCHIATRIC-DISTINCT PART UNIT OF A HOSPITAL

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The patient will be admitted to a rehabilitation facility designed for improving, maintaining, or restoring physical strength, cognition, speech, or mobility.
The patient will remain in a basic hospital environment for a brief time.
The patient will be admitted into a medical center equipped with a trained nursing staff that is eligible to receive Medicare funding.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: SKILLED NURSING FACILITY (SNF) WITH MEDICARE CERTIFICATION IN ANTICIPATION OF COVERED SKILLED CARE
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Skilled Nursing Facility with Medicare Certification in Anticipation of Covered Skilled Care
